snippet: Mitt Romney is seen by more voters as a strong leader after his debate performance last week, but positive economic news appears to have buffered President Obama.
abstract: Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News poll reveals that more voters in the battleground states of Colorado, Virginia and Wisconsin now view Mitt Romney as a strong leader after his debate performance; poll indicates that more voters in those states view the economy as improving, a boon for Pres Obama.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Megan Thee-Brenan from New York. Allison Kopicki and Marina Stefan contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is seen by more voters as a strong leader after his debate performance last week, but positive economic news appears to have buffered President Obama.

headline.seo: Voters Give Mitt Romney Better Leadership Grades, Polls Find
headline.main: Voters Give Romney Better Grades for Leadership, Polls in 3 States Find
headline.print_headline: Romney Given Better Grades On Leadership
